paragraphs.text: Putin and Ukraine: Expect more brutal aggression from Russia's desperate leader.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The renewal of fighting this week over the Donetsk airport in Eastern Ukraine- an important symbolic target for Russian proxy fighters-- should come as no surprise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The U.S  and Western Europe should expect even more extensive Russia-directed attacks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why? Because of the choice Vladimir Putin made five years ago, confirmed on his reelection in 2012 - and is continuing to make
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After Russia's GDP plunged by almost 8 percent during the 2008-9 world financial crisis
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: there was a virtual consensus among Russian economists that Putin's economic model, which depended on the redistribution of revenues from ever-increasing oil prices, along with growing state control over the economy and rampant corruption, was nearly exhausted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Russia needed to "modernize and diversify,"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as the catch words among such thinkers went
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to do so, the country first and foremost had to "improve the investment climate."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That was a euphemism for tapering off the state's grip on the economy; getting rid of bureaucratic shakedowns of private businesses; ensuring that courts were no longer for sale or open to "instructions" from authorities; strengthening private property rights; and eventually decentralizing and liberalizing the political system
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In short
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: deep institutional reforms
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These were advocated by, among others, Alexei Kudrin, Putin's personal friend and confidant, former finance minister and former first deputy prime minister
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Kudrin was to be a disappointed man
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: paying lip service to "modernization,"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the Kremlin did nothing to advance that agenda
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Two years later, Russia was shaken by pro-democracy, anti-Putin demonstrations in all of Russia's largest cities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Putin got the same message that almost every authoritarian leader gets sooner or later
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: reform and democratize to improve the economy or tighten the screws of repression to deal with discontent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We all know what Putin did
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Upon his presidential reelection in 2012, he issued a slew of laws constraining already limited freedoms of public protest and speech
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The consequences came quickly: even with oil prices over $100 per bbl, growth dwindled to a crawl and capital flight reached record levels
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: By the end of 2013, Putin's popularity was at lowest point in 13 years
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Around half of Russians did not want to see him as president again in 2018
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Yet Putin doubled down once more, using another tried-and-true authoritarian tool: manufactured nationalist patriotic frenzy mixed with paranoia and served up by deafening propaganda
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The anti-corruption, pro-European revolution in Ukraine was presented as an American plot against Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Following the annexation of Crimea in March 2014, those who opposed the regime were labelled the "fifth column" and "national traitors."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Then came war in Ukraine -- aggression by proxy or, last fall, by uniformed Russian troops
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The daily poisoning of Russian hearts and minds on state-controlled national television is now beginning to surpass even Soviet totalitarianism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Western democracies are portrayed as Russia's mortal enemies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who seek to undermine Moscow's sovereignty and enslave its people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This Stalinist-style propaganda is designed to justify the Kremlin's aggression against Ukraine, excuse increasing domestic repression, explain away mounting economic hardships and-- most troubling-- perhaps prepare the country for possible aggression against other neighbors
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Both in his end-of-year press-conference and in his New Year's message to the nation, Putin fixed the propaganda pitch to the highest point
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "We are defending our independence, our sovereignty and our right to exist," he declared
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "We need to accomplish, to realize all that we planned- for ourselves, for the sake of our children, and for the sake of Russia."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: After this, can anyone expect the Russian commander-in-chief to go wobbly on foreign enemies or to abandon ethnic "brethren" fighting against an allegedly genocidal "Nazi junta"-- known to the rest of the world as the elected government in Kiev?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: U.S  and European diplomats keep talking about providing Russia with an "off ramp."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Judging by Putin's rhetoric, there is no ramp high enough for the task
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So long
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Putin sticks with the anti-reform choice
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: escalation appears to be his only tactic for staying in and consolidating power
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This choice preceded the drop in oil prices and Western sanctions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it will outlive them as well
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The West should expect no magic turn-around and prepare to confront but also engage with this Russia over the long haul
paragraphs.label: assumption
